answers.answer: Thank you for your question. Although without being able to examine you I can not offer you the specific advice on diagnosis and treatment that you need, but I would try to provide you some relevant information about your health concern.Most common possibility in your case could be nerve impingement, irritation or compression of nerve and underlying disorder like diabetes/alcohol abuse that may result in neuropathy (nerve pain like numbness and tingling at affected areas). If you suffer continuous weakness and notice reduced strength of muscle bulk in arm as well, please arrange an appointment with a neurologist right away who may be able to differentiate in both the possibilities first. These “red flags” could be indicative of nerve compression and its nerve branches and early treatment is essential if permanent damage needs to be avoided. Further referral to a physiotherapist for exercises could be beneficial and may produce relief of symptoms. Hope this help. Take Care & Stay Healthy!!!

question: I have had severe pain in my right arm for about a year I have been to a neurologist and they have done nerve conduction studies that show severe abnormalities in the nerve bundle of my right arm from when I was 15 and was shot but no one knows why the pain has gotten so bad this year and not before I am now unable to work at all due to the pain and no strength in the right hand but my question is I am now having severe pain almost all the time in my right side also I have a history of kidney stones but they have ruled that out and it does not hurt the same I wanted to know if the damage in my right arm nerve bundle could cause the pain in my right side I appreciate any help you can give meThanks
title: Pain in right side
